newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile shrs seen stable, eyes on Quinenco.
newsitem.headline: Chile shrs seen stable, eyes on Quinenco.

text.p: Chilean blue chips opened broadly higher with attention focused on the launch of Luksic group holding company Quinenco in Santiago and New York, said traders.
Traders reported high interest among local and foreign investors in the firm, which will be Chile's twenty-first company to trade publicly on Wall Street.
"People are betting on Quinenco as a vehicle for the growth of the Luksic group," said one trader.
Nearly 29 million Quinenco shares were sold at the minimum price of 750.96 pesos per share in a stock offering Wednesday.
The 40-share .IPSA index opened up 0.16 percent at 132.67 points.
Analysts said the market reacted with mild relief to news that the government had finally set new electricity distribution prices after winning a court battle against power companies over the rates.
A notice in the government gazette Wednesday announced sharp price cuts, including a 12 percent reduction for Chile's largest power distributor Chilectra.
"I don't think the electricity rates are a big surprise -- on the contrary, it's positive to get them out of the way," said David Hurd, head of research at Merrill Lynch.

Power generator Chilgener stock is expected to be volatile over the next couple of months as the company has recently started selling preferential shares in its $500 million rights issue. ((-- Margaret Orgill, Santiago newsroom, 562-699-5595 x212))
